00022 /*
00023 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00024 
00025 The PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method produces
00026 an improved signal by accounting for experimentally observed patterns 
00027 in probe behavior and handling error at the appropriately at low and 
00028 high signal values.
00029 
00030 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00031 */
00032 
00033 #if !defined(_PLIERALGORITHM_HEADER_)
00034 #define _PLIERALGORITHM_HEADER_
00035 
00036 #include "plier/affyplier.h"
00037 //
00038 
00039 typedef struct
00040 {
00041         long                                    m_nAnalyses;
00042         long                                    m_nFeatures;
00043         long*                                   m_nReplicates;
00044         double*                         m_fTargetResponse;
00045         double*                         m_fFeatureResponse;
00046         double**                        m_fPM;
00047         double**                        m_fMM;
00048         double**                        m_fRS; // residuals
00049         double**                        m_fWT; // weights for data points
00050         bool                                    m_bUseModel;
00051         plier_params*   m_algParams;
00052 } plier_data;
00053 
00054 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00055 
00056 typedef struct {
00057         double *TargetResponse;
00058         double *OldTargetResponse;
00059         double *TDeriv;
00060         double *TGrad; // diagonal only
00061         double *TStep;
00062         double *FeatureResponse;
00063         double *OldFeatureResponse;
00064         double *FDeriv;
00065         double *FGrad; // diagonal only
00066         double *FStep; // step size
00067 
00068         double **IMinusB; // I-Background
00069         double **U; // I-Background transformed
00070         double **IHash; // log/glog magic value for each probe
00071         double **Weight; // weight for each probe pair
00072         long *OldOrder;
00073 
00074         double LogLikelihood;
00075         double oldLogLikelihood;
00076 
00077 } plier_datasheet;

00081 long NewtonPlier(plier_data* pData, double& output);
00082 long Compute_Signed_Residuals(plier_data* pData, long ResidualType);
